name: The Shattered Realms

setting.description: A thousand years ago, the God-Emperor Kaelos fell in battle against the Void, and his death shattered the world. The great continent of Aethermoor broke into rival kingdoms, each claiming a fragment of divine power. Now the seals weaken, the Void stirs, and the realms must unite—or be consumed.
setting.era: The Age of Fragments, Year 1047 AF (After the Fall)

polity.ironhold.name: The Iron Kingdom
polity.ironhold.description: Forged in the aftermath of the Fall, the Iron Kingdom believes strength is the only path to survival. Their warrior-kings have conquered the richest mines and forges, and their legions are the most disciplined in the realms.

polity.silverwood.name: The Sylvan Covenant
polity.silverwood.description: The elven lords of Silverwood guard the greatest repository of pre-Fall knowledge. They have mastered the old magics but grow ever more detached from mortal affairs, viewing the younger races as children playing at civilization.

polity.freehold.name: The Merchant Princes of Freehold
polity.freehold.description: Where the rivers meet the sea, Freehold rose as a haven for those who swear no fealty to kings. The Merchant Princes rule through gold, and their ships carry goods—and spies—to every port.

polity.duskwatch.name: The Order of the Duskwatch
polity.duskwatch.description: The last true servants of Kaelos, the Duskwatch guards the Veil—the barrier between the mortal world and the Void. They have sacrificed everything for their vigil, but their numbers dwindle and the darkness grows stronger.

threat.void.name: The Void
threat.void.description: Not a faction in the traditional sense, but an ever-present threat. The Void seeps through weakened seals, corrupting land and mind alike. Its servants—the Hollow Ones—were once mortal, now they are hunger given form.

starting_tensions.description: The Iron Kingdom claims the River Marches as ancestral lands; Freehold insists the trade routes must remain open.
The Duskwatch demands the elves share their magical knowledge to fight the Void; the Covenant refuses to arm 'children' with dangerous power.
The Void incursions grow more frequent. The Duskwatch warns of a Great Breach within the decade.
The aging Iron King has three children, each with powerful backers. The succession is uncertain.

key_locations.region.iron_marches: Heartland of the Iron Kingdom, rich in ore and fortresses
key_locations.region.silverwood: The ancient elven forest, where time flows strangely
key_locations.region.delta: The river delta controlled by Freehold, hub of continental trade
key_locations.region.duskwall: The border with the Void, guarded by the Duskwatch
key_locations.locale.thornhold: Capital of the Iron Kingdom, city of steel and stone
key_locations.locale.starfall: Heart of the Sylvan Covenant, built in a meteor crater
key_locations.locale.portway: Greatest city of Freehold, where all rivers meet the sea
key_locations.locale.last_light: Fortress-monastery of the Duskwatch, on the edge of the Void

agent.king_aldric.role: Iron King, aging warrior seeking legacy
agent.king_aldric.motivation: Unite the realms under Iron rule before his death

agent.archon_velenis.role: Voice of the Council, ancient elf lord
agent.archon_velenis.motivation: Preserve elven knowledge and power at any cost

agent.prince_marcus.role: First Merchant Prince, master of coin
agent.prince_marcus.motivation: Profit from the coming war, survive to spend it

agent.high_warden_sera.role: Leader of the Duskwatch, bearer of the Shard
agent.high_warden_sera.motivation: Convince the realms to unite before the Great Breach

agent.princess_elena.role: Youngest child of King Aldric, secretly studying magic
agent.princess_elena.motivation: Prove magic and steel can work together

victory_conditions.unity: The Divine Fragments are reunited and the Void is sealed
victory_conditions.domination: One faction controls all regions and fragments
victory_conditions.survival: The Great Breach is prevented or survived

loss_conditions.void_victory: The Void consumes more than 50% of the realm
loss_conditions.fragment_destruction: A Divine Fragment is destroyed or corrupted
loss_conditions.total_war: All factions are at war simultaneously for 10+ years

narrative_hooks: Princess Elena's magic is discovered—scandal or opportunity?
A Void breach opens in the River Marches, neutral ground becomes battlefield
An ancient elven prophecy names a human as the Reuniter
The Iron King falls ill—succession crisis accelerates
A Merchant Prince offers to fund the Duskwatch—for a price
The Hollow Ones begin speaking, offering bargains
A fifth Divine Fragment is rumored to exist, hidden in the Wastes

divine.description: Power channeled from the Divine Fragments, strongest against the Void

arcane.description: Knowledge-based magic from the pre-Fall era, versatile but dangerous
arcane.cost: Years of study, risk of Void corruption

void.description: Power from beyond the Veil, corrupting but potent
